title: 'Unprecedented' flooding in France expected to last all week
subhead: With most of the country still on flood alert, a new storm system arriving from Brittany is set to impact France on Wednesday and Thursday, bringing another bout of heavy rainfall and winds.

title: Diplomat Anne-Claire Legendre nominated to succeed Jack Lang at Arab World Institute
Who owns second homes in France?
Six suspects sought in murder probe over far-right activist's death in Lyon
subhead: The prosecutor detailed the violent incident that led to the death of young far-right activist Quentin Deranque. Meanwhile, accusations against antifascist activists have spread through far-right online networks.

title: Frederick Wiseman, legendary American documentary filmmaker, dies at 96
subhead: The creator of an immense and unparalleled social portrait of American society, who filmed everything from hospitals to department stores and museums, died on Monday at the age of 96.

title: French music festivals to book for late winter and early spring
subhead: Electronic music, rock, chanson française, hip-hop... From Paris to Marseille, via Saint-Malo or Caen, the French festival scene offers an abundance of options sure to satisfy every musical taste.

title: Robert Duvall, singular figure of New Hollywood, has died
subhead: Known for his roles in 'The Godfather' and 'Apocalypse Now,' two films by Francis Ford Coppola, the actor – who was also a screenwriter, director and producer – died on Sunday, February 15, at the age of 95.

In substance, Rubio's message in Munich was the same as Vance's
subhead: While the US secretary of state struck a less aggressive tone toward Europe than the American vice president had a year earlier, the substance of the speech changed little.

title: South Korea's 'comfort women' take on the US military
subhead: For decades, thousands of South Korean women were forced into prostitution for the pleasure of American soldiers, with the support of the Seoul government. They are now seeking reparations.

title: How Jeffrey Epstein built the global network that protected him
subhead: The sexual predator, who came from a modest background, used his scheming and manipulation to open the doors to the global elite. His influence was such that many powerful figures continued to associate with him, even after his first conviction in 2008.

title: 'The fall of the cumbersome Jack Lang is seen as providential for France's political spectrum, which remains paralyzed by his cultural legacy'
'By sacrificing American soft power, Trump is exacerbating his country's unpopularity and prompting Europeans to exercise their own'
'The Mediterranean does not have to be a graveyard. Preventable failures are turning it into one'
